alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 07 at 4:58PM MST until January 09 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ MONDAY TO 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 10 inches. Northerly winds sustained at 25 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * WHERE...Cheyenne County in Colorado and Wallace, Logan, Gove, Greeley and Wichita counties in Kansas. * WHEN...From 5 AM Monday to 5 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous or impossible travel conditions. Road closures are likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow will rapidly develop across the warning area early Monday morning. Conditions will rapidly deteriorate around, or shortly after, sunrise.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
